content.rendered:
Tokeny Insights February 2019

Hello  

Thank you for reading this month’s edition and for all of the support we receive each time we share resources on tokenized securities.

What became obvious in the past month is that traditional finance players are beginning to publicly express positive stances towards digital assets. Yesterday we met with Mr Pierre Gramegna, Luxembourg Finance Minister, where we held encouraging discussions on how blockchain can transform one of the most active financial centres in Europe. It seems as though the tides are beginning to turn with significant actors in financial markets.

Digital assets, asset-backed tokens or security tokens? Many commentators are still debating the wording that should be used to qualify the representation of securities on a blockchain. It’s been a hot topic for the month, but to be frank, we’re not concerned. We’re here because we believe in the technology and the impact it will have, not because of our interest in semantics. One thing is for sure, connotations are derived from associations. The negative opinions that have followed the activities of 2017-2018 are changing as traditional and reputable entities begin to get their feet wet. It seems that the key players now understand that crypto and blockchain are two very different things.

I hope you have found this edition useful. If you have any questions then please do not hesitate to contact us.

Best wishes,
Luc Falempin
Tokeny CEO

MARKET SPOTLIGHT

Significant news and insights selected by our team of security token experts

 

1.The Security Token Market Needs Better Lingo

Security token offering, or STO, fails to capture the nuanced differences among the types of securities to be sold as tokens.

Coindesk

Read more

2. Blockport Plans for Expansion – Announces Security Token Offering

Blockchain based crypto exchange, Blockport, has announced their intention to host an upcoming security token offering held on the Tokeny platform to raise a minimum of $30 million EUR.

Securities.io

Read more

3. WhiteDeck – The Ultimate STO Pitch Framework

Security Token Network’s WhiteDeck is the complete guide to pitch and fundraise for a STO, supported by 50 experts and 25 companies.

Security Token Network

Read more

4. Swiss Stock Exchange To Launch Its Own Security Token This Year

The Switzerland Stock Exchange (SIX) wants to launch its own security token offering (STO), sometime in H2, 2019 alongside its Digital currency Exchange platform SDX.

Bitcoinist

Read more

5. Overstock’s tZERO Token Platform Has Officially Opened for Trading

Overstock.com’s much-anticipated security token trading platform, tZERO, officially began trading.

Coindesk

Read more

COMPLIANCE IN FOCUS

Compliance and regulatory news curated by our team of industry insiders

 1. From the UK to Malaysia: How Countries Have Been Classifying Crypto Across the World

A summary on how crypto is classified across the world, including UK, Japan, China, united states, Germany, Switzerland, South Korea, Malta and Malaysia.

Cointelegraph

Read more

2. Singapore Halts Security Token Offering: Beware The LinkedIn Post 

The Monetary Authority of Singapore (“MAS”) announced that it had issued a warning in connection with a proposed token sale that contravened the Securities and Futures Act(“SFA”).

Lexology

Read more

3. Will Security Tokens Make 2019 the Year of Finance Innovation?

The laws for securities have been around for many decades, created in a time where the internet didn’t exist. Blockchain has been complicating all of this.

Blockchain Land

Read more

4. Security Token Offerings: A Cautionary Tale of Reg D Offerings

Reg D has become the most popular exemption for Security Token Offerings (STOs).  This exemption allows the issuer to generally solicit investors for their offering.
Crowdfund Insider

Read more

5. New Regulatory Framework for Digital Asset Token Offering Introduced in Philippines

The new regulations released by the country’s Cagayan Economic Zone Authority (CEZA) are reportedly designed to regulate the cryptocurrency industry and protect investors.

Cointelegraph

Read more

Subscribe to the newsletter:

Subscribe
